noun.description: The action or process of adding something to something else.
examples: the hotel has been extended with the addition of more rooms

noun.description: The process or skill of calculating the total of two or more numbers or amounts.
examples: she began with simple arithmetic, addition and then subtraction

phrases: members of the board were paid a small allowance in addition to their normal salary
That in addition to monthly remuneration at the same rate he was paid while head of state.
Some employers also offer extra time off and more money for fathers in addition to SPP.
The Treasury has given several hundred million pounds in addition to what we are already putting in.
It is one of the few of its kind in the country and, in addition to Bolton, it will also serve surrounding towns.
origin: Late Middle English: from Latin additio(n-), from the verb addere (see add).
